blocks.text: Example 5—Find the dimensions of the greatest cylinder that can be inscribed in a right circular cone of height 6 ins. and base 10 ins. diameter.

blocks.caption: Figure 24.
blocks.description: The figure shows a right circular cone with a cylinder inscribed within it, illustrating the relationship between the cone and the cylinder dimensions.

blocks.text: Assume that the radius of the base of the cylinder = r ins. (Fig. 24) and the height of the cylinder = y ins.
In this example, we obtain an expression for y in terms of r before differentiating with regard to r.
From the figure, by similar triangles, taking the triangles ADC and EDC:

blocks.description: This equation relates the radius of the cylinder to its height using the dimensions of the cone.
This equation expresses the height of the cylinder in terms of its radius.

blocks.text: Therefore, the volume of the cylinder is given by

blocks.latex: V = \pi r^{2} y = \pi r^{2} \left(\frac{6}{5} r\right) = \frac{6\pi}{5} r^{3}
blocks.description: This equation provides the formula for the volume of the cylinder.

blocks.text: Now, substituting \( r = 5(1 - 3s) \) into the equation, we find the maximum volume.
If we let \( r = \frac{5}{3} \), we find the maximum volume, V = 8\cdot8 ins.
